peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I know if my mirror is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Examining the Glass: Age Indicators Antique mirror glass typically has a slight grey or yellow tint. Small bubbles or inconsistencies in the glass are signs of age. These features help confirm the mirror's authenticity and add to its value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How To Identify Your Antique Mirrors Value Our Guide - Reperch

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is a Carolina mirror?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: About Carolina Mirror For over 50 years, our family-owned company has been handmaking stunning mirrors that become cherished heirlooms. Using centuries-old techniques perfected through generations, our master artisans cut and bevel glass, handcraft solid wood frames, and finish each piece with artisanal care.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Carolina Mirror® Glass & Mirror Official Website

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I tell how old a mirror is?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Look at the mirror's edge to get an idea of its depth and, therefore, a clue to its age. In some cases, the mirror's frame will provide clues about age, too. Look for the maker's name and signs of ageing, such as scuffs, since you'd expect to see these with older mirrors.
